content: Last week Leno lectured Elizabeth Hasselbeck on what a mean person Rush Limbaugh was. Leno recently promised to give a free show for the disadvantaged and unemployed in Detroit. Some of the disadvantaed and unemployed decided they'd rather have the money than go see Leno. They put their tickets up on E-Bay. An incensed Leno put the Kaibosh on it. "How dare those ungrateful unemployed folks derive any real benefit from my benefit show." When faced with the fact that some of the "poor" thought they needed money more than a joke or two, Leno's ego overruled and unmasked his altruistic gesture. It's always like this with the left and liberals. It's all feelings and perception and never anything substantial.
reply: Last week Leno lectured Elizabeth Hasselbeck on what a mean person Rush Limbaugh was. Leno recently promised to give a free show for the disadvantaged and unemployed in Detroit. title: Leno:Ego Trumps Altruism

content: I've gotten a lot of free tickets to concerts over the years because I'm in the military. Leann Womack, Metallica, etc. The tickets were given out to show appreciation for the military, not for me to scalp because I needed the money more. I'd like to see the link so I can read more on this story.

content: Anyone ever want to go to a concert, show, or sporting event only to find out it was sold out? Or rather, scalpers have all available tickets? It seems to me that this is something Jay Leno is trying to prevent for his show in Detroit. I'm fine with that. It's his show. It also occurs to me that M1 should have a beef with e-bay. They're the people who made the decision to stop ticket sales through their internet auction site. Or is Leno somehow behind the scenes pulling the strings at e-bay. Anyone catch The Factor when Oreilly names Mr. Leno a "Patriot" for doing this show? I did and agree with him 100 percent.
